DataElement.preferredName: Total Blood Product Collection Volume Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity documenting the total volume of all blood or blood products collected which are suitable for proteomic and genomic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._Any process that harvests blood or blood products for clinical or manufacturing purposes._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:Any process that harvests blood or blood products for clinical or manufacturing purposes.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Any process that harvests blood or blood products for clinical or manufacturing purposes.

Property.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 9/27/20 jk created for Solid Tumor Procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
